pygissim package

Submodules

pygissim.engine module

engine.py

These classes and functions are the building blocks for simulating a compute system. They are grouped in this file by function: (general, network, compute, queue, work)

class pygissim.engine.QueueMetric(source: str, stc_type: str, clock: int, channel_count: int, request_count: int)[source]

Bases: object

DataClass for tracking the utilization rate of all queues (compute and network)

Parameters:

  • source (str) – The name of the MultiQueue that was measured.

  • stc_type (str) – The type of the MultiQueue’s ServiceTimeCalculator’.

  • clock (int) – The simulation time (in ms) when the measurement was taken.

  • channel_count (int) – The number of parallel channels in the MultiQueue.

  • request_count – The number of requests being processed and queued.

channel_count: int
clock: int
request_count: int
source: str
stc_type: str
utilization() → float[source]

Utility function to return the utilization of a network connection or a compute node.

  • Channels represents the number of parallel channels to do work. If they are all full, then 1.0 is returned (100%)

  • If all channels are full and more requests were waiting, then the result will be more than 1.0 (> 100%)

class pygissim.engine.RequestMetric(source: str, clock: int, request_name: str, workflow_name: str, service_time: int, queue_time: int, latency_time: int)[source]

Bases: object

DataClass for tracking the utilization rate of all queues (compute and network). A RequestMetric is reported every time a ClientRequest leaves a MultiQueue. The time values represent the service time, queue time and latency time the ClientRequest experienced between being enqueued and completed.

Parameters:

  • source (str) – The name of the MultiQueue that was measured.

  • clock (int) – The simulation time (in ms) when the measurement was taken.

  • request_name (str) – The name of the ClientRequest.

  • workflow_name (str) – The name of the Workflow.

  • service_time (int) – The time spent processing the ClientRequest (in ms).

  • queue_time (int) – The time spent in queue (in ms).

  • latency_time (int) – The time spent in latency (in ms).

clock: int
latency_time: int
queue_time: int
request_name: str
service_time: int
source: str
workflow_name: str

class pygissim.engine.ServiceTimeCalculator[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for classes that will be delegates for a MultiQueue to calculate service time and latency time. The two subclasses are Connection and ComputeNode.

abstractmethod calculate_latency(request: ClientRequest) → int[source]
abstractmethod calculate_service_time(request: ClientRequest) → int[source]

pygissim.util module

util.py

LibManager loads CSV data from the /data directory. Bootstraps useful things like hardware definitions.

class pygissim.util.LibManager[source]

Bases: object

Contains all of the code to load the libraries of hardware, services and workflows.

DATA_PATH: str = 'data'
classmethod get_full_path_to_data_file(data_file: str) → str[source]

Utility method to resolve the relative path to data files.

load_hardware_local()[source]

Loads the preconfigured hardware types and SPECint_rate2017 scores.

load_local()[source]

Loads all of the dictionaries from CSV. The order is important, as the workflow definitions reference the workflow chains, etc.

load_services_local()[source]

Loads the service definitions.

load_wf_chains_local()[source]

Loads the chains of steps that make up a request and response.

load_wf_defs_local()[source]

Loads the groups of chains that make a composite workflow definition.

load_wf_steps_local()[source]

Loads the performance metrics for individual workflow steps.
